subject: Re: [junit] Can I create a dynamic JUnit ?  (in Cactus Framework)
msgSnippet: ... Google Parameterized Test Case or look at _JUnit Recipes_, chapters 4 and 5. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Donny Widjaja wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I am running my JUnit within Cactus Framework. I am thinking of
> making a generic testcase that takes three parameters (or more if
> necessary). They are: method name, input file, and the expected
> output file.
>
> I created a constructor that take 3 parameteres and remove the generic
> (no-args) constructor, but it seems that JUnit requires the generic
> constructor no matter what.
>
> I tried to create a test suite that calls my own constructor.
> suite.addTest(new tester("testPositive", inputFile, outputFile);
>
> When I debug my code, I saw that JUnit calls my constructor, and added
> the object into the suite. However, when it runs the test case, it
> try to re-create the object again by calling generic constructor with
> no-args or one arguments.
>
> Does anybody have an idea on how can I pass some information into
> JUnit using the parameters from command line?

Google "Parameterized Test Case" or look at _JUnit Recipes_, chapters 4
and 5.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
